body_html:
Fink builds from source. It needs to be able to control the entire setup process. Looking in the wheel, I find:

file tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so
tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so: Mach-O 64-bit dynamically linked shared library x86_64

otool -L tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so
tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so:
bazel-out/local-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so (compatibility version 0.0.0, current version 0.0.0)
/System/Library/Frameworks/IOKit.framework/Versions/A/IOKit (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 275.0.0)
/usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1226.10.1)
/usr/lib/libc++.1.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 120.1.0)

If for fink, I need to change anything about compile options or linking (which we do), I'm SOL.

body:
Fink builds from source.  It needs to be able to control the entire setup process.  Looking in the wheel, I find:

file tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so
tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so: Mach-O 64-bit dynamically linked shared library x86_64

otool -L tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so
tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so:
	bazel-out/local-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so (compatibility version 0.0.0, current version 0.0.0)
	/System/Library/Frameworks/IOKit.framework/Versions/A/IOKit (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 275.0.0)
	/usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1226.10.1)
	/usr/lib/libc++.1.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 120.1.0)

If for fink, I need to change anything about compile options or linking (which we do), I'm SOL.
